decision_conditions: The proposal would, by reason of a deficit in internal floor area, poor levels of outlook, lack of external amenity space and location on the second floor would result in an unsatisfactory level of amenity for future occupiers and would not demonstrate a high quality living environment thereby contrary to Policy 3.5 of the London Plan, Policy DC61 and DC04 of the LDF Core Strategy and Development Control Policies DPD and Residential Design Supplementary Planning Document 2010.

Statement Required by Article 35 (2) of the Town and Country Planning (Development Management Procedure) (England) Order 2015: Consideration was given to seeking amendments, but given conflict with adopted planning policy, notification of intended refusal and the reason(s) for it was given to the applicant Mr A Levitan via email on 25 October 2019

The proposal, if granted planning permission on appeal, would be liable for the Havering Community Infrastructure Levy (CIL) and Mayor of London CIL. Based upon the information supplied with the application, the CIL payable would be Â£10,800. Further details with regard to CIL are available from the Council's website.
description: Two one bedroom flats to second floor, following previous approval for a single second floor residential flat
